firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure prioritizes authorization independence and QAPs. User data is stored under `/users/{userId}`, enabling path-based ownership. Search history is located at `/users/{userId}/searchHistory/{searchHistoryId}`, also leveraging path-based ownership. This structure ensures that security rules can be written without relying on `get()` calls to parent documents, thus guaranteeing authorization independence.  The design uses structural segregation by storing each user's search history in a dedicated subcollection, which enforces a homogeneous security posture.  QAPs are satisfied because listing search history is straightforward and secure via rules enforcing `request.auth.uid == userId`.
